content.question: Identical charged particles move with the same initial velocity as they enter three regions each containing uniform magnetic fields of the same magnitude but different direction, as shown. After a short time interval <math alttext="delta t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Î”</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, the particles in regions <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> have speeds <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="v sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="v sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 1 equals, v sub 2, which equals v sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2, which is greater than v sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub 3 is greater than v sub 1, which is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub 3 equals v sub 2, which is greater than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub 1 equals, v sub 2, which equals v sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
